sentence1: I cosponsored H.Res. 36, legislation sponsored by Rep. Frank Wolf forming a select committee to expeditiously investigate and definitively report on the terrorist attacks on the U.S. Consulate in Benghazi, Libya, that claimed four American lives including our U.S. Ambassador to Libya.   Over a year later, important questions remain unanswered. It is my hope that this committee will shine a light on that dark day and bring justice for four American patriots and their loved ones.  Our countrymen who serve on the frontlines of diplomacy and work to advance our nationÛªs interests must know that we will provide whatever resources are needed to ensure their safety. Those who seek to harm them and to sabotage American interests must know that America will never rest until justice has been carried out.
label: national

sentence1: Condolences to the family of Captain Jim Henry, who passed away today at the age of 99. His book, "In a Fisherman's Language," which he published at the age of 98--just seven years after he learned to read--is a story that will inspire all of us. It was a privilege to meet him and his beautiful family, and to help the Library of Congress to accept his work. Fair winds and safe journey, Captain Jim.
